graph_gen_utils
Class NeoFromFile

java.lang.Object
  graph_gen_utils.NeoFromFile

public class NeoFromFile
extends java.lang.Object

Provides easy means of creating a Neo4j instance from various graph file formats, loading a Neo4j instance into an in-memory graph, calculating various graph metrics and writing them to file.

Since:
2010-04-01
Author:
Alex Averbuch

applyPtnToNeo

public void applyPtnToNeo(Partitioner partitioner)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Allocates nodes of a Neo4j instance to clusters/partitions. Allocation scheme is defined by the Partitioner parameter. Method writes Consts.COLOR property to all nodes of an existing Neo4j instance. Consts.NAME property is also written to all nodes and set to Node.getId().

Parameters:
partitioner - implementation of Partitioner that defines cluster/partition allocation scheme
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeNeoFromTopology

public void writeNeoFromTopology(GraphTopology topology)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Neo4j instance and populates it according to a generated graph topology. Examples of possible topologies are random ( GraphTopologyRandom) and fully connected ( GraphTopologyFullyConnected) graphs.

Parameters:
topology - instance of GraphTopology the defines generated topology
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeNeoFromTopologyAndPtn

public void writeNeoFromTopologyAndPtn(GraphTopology topology,
                                       Partitioner partitioner)
                                throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Neo4j instance, populates it according to a generated graph topology, then allocates Nodes to partitions/clusters. Examples of possible topologies are random (GraphTopologyRandom) and fully connected (GraphTopologyFullyConnected) graphs. Allocation scheme is defined by the Partitioner parameter.

Parameters:
topology - instance of GraphTopology the defines generated topology
partitioner - implementation of Partitioner that defines cluster/partition allocation scheme
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeNeoFromChaco

public void writeNeoFromChaco(java.lang.String graphPath)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Neo4j instance and populates it from the contents of a Chaco (.graph) file. Chaco files are basically persistent adjacency lists.

Parameters:
graphPath - String representing path to .graph file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeNeoFromChacoAndPtn

public void writeNeoFromChacoAndPtn(java.lang.String graphPath,
                                    java.lang.String ptnPath)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Neo4j instance, populates it from the contents of a Chaco (.graph) file, then allocates Nodes to partitions/clusters. Chaco files are basically persistent adjacency lists. Partition/cluster allocation is defined by the contents of a .ptn file. This method is only included for convenience/ease of use. writeNeoFromChacoAndPtn(String, Partitioner) can achieve the same thing.

Parameters:
graphPath - String representing path to .graph file
ptnPath - String representing path to .ptn file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeNeoFromChacoAndPtn

public void writeNeoFromChacoAndPtn(java.lang.String graphPath,
                                    Partitioner partitioner)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Neo4j instance, populates it from the contents of a Chaco (.graph) file, then allocates Nodes to partitions/clusters. Chaco files are basically persistent adjacency lists. Allocation scheme is defined by the Partitioner parameter.

Parameters:
graphPath - String representing path to .graph file
partitioner - implementation of Partitioner that defines cluster/partition allocation scheme
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeNeoFromGML

public void writeNeoFromGML(java.lang.String gmlPath)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Neo4j instance and populates it from the contents of a GML (.gml) file. GML files are basically an ASCII version of the GraphML format.

Parameters:
gmlPath - String representing path to .gml file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeChaco

public void writeChaco(java.lang.String chacoPath,
                       NeoFromFile.ChacoType chacoType)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Chaco file and populates it with the adjacency list representation of the current Neo4j instance. Chaco files are assumed to be undirected, this means edges are duplicated in each direction.

Parameters:
chacoPath - String representing path to .graph file
chacoType - NeoFromFile.ChacoType specifies whether node and/or edge weights are written to the chaco file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeChacoAndPtn

public void writeChacoAndPtn(java.lang.String chacoPath,
                             NeoFromFile.ChacoType chacoType,
                             java.lang.String ptnPath)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a Chaco (.graph) file and partition (.ptn) files, populates them with the representation of the current Neo4j instance. Chaco files are assumed to be undirected, this means edges are duplicated in each direction.

Parameters:
chacoPath - String representing path to .graph file
chacoType - NeoFromFile.ChacoType specifies whether node and/or edge weights are written to the chaco file
ptnPath - String representing path to .ptn file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeGMLFull

public void writeGMLFull(java.lang.String gmlPath)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a GML (.gml) file and populates it with the representation of the current Neo4j instance. All Node and Relationship properties are written to the GML file.

Parameters:
gmlPath - String representing path to .gml file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeGMLBasic

public void writeGMLBasic(java.lang.String gmlPath)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
Creates a GML (.gml) file and populates it with the representation of the current Neo4j instance. Only certain Node and Relationship properties are written to the GML file. Consts.COLOR, Consts.WEIGHT, Consts.NAME, and Consts.ID.

Parameters:
gmlPath - String representing path to .gml file
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

writeMetrics

public void writeMetrics(java.lang.String metricsPath)
Calculates graph metrics for the current Neo4j instance, creates a metrics (.met) file and populates it.

Parameters:
metricsPath - String representing path to .met file

writeMetricsCSV

public void writeMetricsCSV(java.lang.String metricsPath)
Calculates graph metrics for the current Neo4j instance, creates a comma separated metrics (.met) file and populates it.

Parameters:
metricsPath - String representing path to .met file

appendMetricsCSV

public void appendMetricsCSV(java.lang.String metricsPath,
                             java.lang.Long timeStep)
Calculates graph metrics for the current Neo4j instance and appends the results to a comma separated metrics (.met) file.

Parameters:
metricsPath - String representing path to .met file

readMemGraphDirected

public MemGraph readMemGraphDirected()
Loads the current Neo4j instance into a directed in-memory graph. Edges are unidirectional, and directions are exactly as in Neo4j instance.

Returns:
MemGraph

readMemGraphUndirected

public MemGraph readMemGraphUndirected()
Loads the current Neo4j instance into an undirected in-memory graph. Edges are bidirectional. Because the in-memory graph is stored as an adjacency list it means edges will be duplicated and memory consumption will be higher when using an undirected graph.

Returns:
MemGraph
